title: Arsenal news: Max Allegri keen to stay at Juventus | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 5:30 pm Allegri wants to stay with Juventus (Picture: Getty) 
Max Allegri had revealed he hopes to spend another ‘300 or 400’ games in charge of Juventus, despite speculation linking him with Arsenal. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The former AC Milan boss was thought to be one of the main men in the frame to replace Arsene Wenger, whose future is unclear. 
There also appeared to be some unrest in the Juventus camp in general, with Allegri reportedly falling out with several senior members of the squad. 
But speaking ahead of his side’s Serie A clash with Cagliari, which will be Allegri’s 100th game in charge, he expressed his desire to stay with the Italian champions. Wenger’s future is in doubt (Picture: Getty) 
‘I hope there are another 300 or 400 games as I am happy at Juventus,’ he said. 
‘As for my future, how can I confirm something that doesn’t exist or deny something I never said?
